availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Madison, Indiana, soldier. Madison native. Son of Alouis Bachman. Attended Hanover College from 1856 to 1858. Attended the Kentucky Military Institute from 1858 to 1860. Organized the Madison City Greys in 1861. Captain in the Sixth Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment. Major and lieutenant colonel in the Nineteenth Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment. Died at the Battle of Antietam on September 17, 1862.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, 6th Ward, Madison, p. 659. Index to Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Indiana, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M540, Roll 0003. David, Stevenson and Theodore T. Scribner,* Indiana's Roll of Honor*. (Indianapolis: A.D. Streight, 1864), 347, 881-883. “Alois O. Bachman,” Indiana Historical Bureau, http://www.in.gov/history/markers/385.htm.
